reviews.text: My mother and I returned to her home of TAllahassee to reminisce and re visit the south of old. It is something that we have always wanted to do. It was incredible!!!!! The lodge is absolutely gorgeous. No TV, just the traveler and the old south. It was the wet and rainy version of FLorida, but very real. each evening after dinner we sat in the lobby with Joe the alligator who lost his life to poachers, we enjoyed the quiet surroundings and the moist environment. We had several spectacular meals in the dining room. We met Mom's highschool friends and caught up on life. We rediscovered our roots. Why go to DIsney World when this beautiful spot is still with us!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.title: Welcome to the True South
That's a real Florida
reviews.text: We visited Wakulla Springs a couple of years ago and also this April. It was a very refreshing tour of Florida pristine waters. Incredible! So many fish, and different types of birds, turtles, snakes and, of course, alligators! Great and funny tour guides, and you can see how they love their job (we even repeated our toures a couple of times). Loved diving from the platform into the cool, clean and crystal clear water, admired jumping fish right in frint of swimmers and a very visible big gator on the other side of the river. Good restaurant and rooms without any TV. Only bothering thing was loud A/C, everything else was perfect for very stressed-out and overworked residents of Georgia.

Wakulla Springs Lodge - the worst room we've ever stayed in. We arrived at midnight with a reservation and were too tired to drive on to Tallahassee. The $95 room was dismal - more raw wood on the ancient furniture than finish, lumpy beds, the windows would open - but the screens and blinds were flithy, A/C had a bad smell, bathroom was dirty...etc.
reviews.title: Drive ON!
A Taste of the Real Florida - Every tourist should visit.
reviews.text: Also, the staff (on the phone) had advised us we could bicycle over to the St Marks trail - the reason we had decided to stay at the lodge. It was a disappointment to find we could get there only via the highway with no shoulders. We checked out early and drove over instead.

reviews.title: LIVING IN THE PAST
reviews.text: In the old days, when my husband was a boy (in the fifties) Wakulla Springs had a 3-tiered platform for jumping into the spring. But, with today's safety worries, the highest tier has been removed. But still, the second tier is high enough for plenty of thrills, about 2-1/2 stories high, then 120 feet deep into the water. Don't worry about those gators lounging on the other bank, they haven't eaten a tourist yet. And if you want to see more gators, don't miss the river boat tour. (The glass bottom boat tour is optional, no big deal, but the river boat tour is a must.) Our guide said he's never taken out a tour without seeing several alligators. We saw at least a dozen, plus jumping fish and lots of birds. Many old movies were filmed here, including some Tarzan pictures. The hotel is very old so don't stay here is you need upscale ammenities, but the history is fascinating and the restaurant has great Southern fried chicken and many other good dishes, too. (You can visit the spring and stay elsewhere if you wish; this is a Florida State Park - $4 per carload.) My grandkids, who think anything worth doing has to have batteries, loved it here and are begging to go back.
Disclosure: I like eclectic places and am attracted to interesting, historic or off-the-beaten-path locations. I'm not too fussy.
reviews.title: Historic, nice but past its prime

likes.liked: — Generally peaceful vibe and lovely outdoor area.

reviews.text: OVERVIEW: This was probably a really fine place to stay in its day. It's interesting for its history and natural setting, however calling this accommodation a "Lodge" is stretching the truth. It's a modest hotel without a great deal of amenities and its character is sadly quite faded.
reviews.title: Loved the Lodge, fantastic antiques through out

reviews.text: LOCATION: Pretty much in the middle of nowhere. The closest sizable town (besides Tallahassee 15 miles away) is Crawfordville, which has basic services. I guess what I'm saying is, expect to get to Wakulla and not find much in the way of shopping or dining. The scenery is lovely and is the main draw.
reviews.title: Lovely, rustic, historic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: HOTEL: Sparse on decor and, unfortunately, on ambience. I can see where this was probably a 'nice' place to visit many years ago, but it's just 'ok' now. The building itself is very attractive and has a lot of potential. It pains me to have to say that, though well-maintained, it's mostly charmless.
reviews.title: Location, location, location

reviews.text: ROOM: I had a queen room (#30) on the front of the building (not water facing). The room was large, had all the things you'd need and was very clean. There's no TV or internet, so bring a good book and plan to just relax. Had marble floors in my room which were lovely, but really cold on the feet. Bathtub was big enough to soak in. Bed was fine, but others may find it either 'lumpy' or 'hard' if you're picky. I sorta felt like I was staying in the guest room at my grandmother's house (if that paints any sort of picture for you).
reviews.title: well done historic hotel
Nice but few amenities
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Lodge for one night during the now annual CreatureFest. The festival and dinner were lots of fun, but be prepared for few if any amenities. The Lodge is old, with poor windows, leading to quite a few bugs flying around our room at night, and with loud air conditioning. There is little insulation, so the noises of other patrons are easy to hear. If you go knowing that you're stepping back in time, you'll enjoy the beautiful views and cold water of the Springs.

reviews.title: refreshingly cool
reviews.text: We stayed at Wakulla Springs Lodge with our two children and loved it!

My family arrived for a overnite stay on our way to Sandestin,we arrived about 6:30pm with reservations. The room was the only one left with only 2 single beds for 2 adults and 2 children. The staff quickly put another roll away bed in the room and was plenty comfortable. If your looking for tv's and video games forget it. But if your looking for orginality and great scenery this is the place. We went swimming the next day in crystal clear water,diving off the platform with scuba divers in caves under us.
reviews.title: Old Florida Charm

likes.liked: — The beatiful view of the river,Originality

reviews.text: We had to wait for 45 minutes for dinner due to a big group of people ahead of us so they gave us free drinks untill our meal arrived(beer ,wine, soft drinks whatever we were drinking. Also do the river boat ride you won't forget it. Lots of crocs,turtles exotic birds and wildlife. Truly a real Florida experiience.
reviews.title: Old Time Charm
Our favorite spot to "chill out
reviews.text: Wakulla Springs Lodge is a great place to stay if you aren't interested in TV and all the modern convienences. The lodge was quiet and restful. The food was excellent. We stayed on Mother's Day weekend and it was the best present I could hope for. Next time we will bring our dive gear to dive in Cherokee sink (watch for snakes) and our bikes to ride.

We really enjoy going to the Wakulla Springs Lodge. My family & I go once a year to "chill out" in the springs.We usually stay 3 or 4 days. The lodge is beautiful. The old fashion elevator gives us a taste of history . We enjoy taking the boat ride to see nature at it's best. Try to do the first boat ride of the day. You get to see the mist/fog disappear. The "Creature from the Black Lagoon" was filmed here. The old fashioned ice cream counter service is fun. The lodge restaurant serves a great breakfast & dinner. You can enjoy the view of the springs etc.while eating. The springs are cold but it makes you feel refreshed. It's great for the hair/skin.. Once you are in you will not want to get out. Don't forget to look at the ceiling of the lobby at the lodge. The wood & painting is beautiful. The rooms don't have t.v. so you can read a good book or go downstairs & play checkers. The lobby has a big screen t.v. & you can request to see "The Creature from the Black Lagoon" movie. This is a place to enjoy & relax. Tallahassee is not to far to go for a drive to see sights. We are going again in the fall.
reviews.title: Timeless
Quiet step back in time
reviews.text: Have been visiting, eating or staying at this facility for over 26 years. It has changed little, which is a good thing. Rooms are simple
